trans-unit.source: You can combine layers of materials to build more complex materials. For example, this screenshot shows the blending of a rust material (left) with a gold material (right):
trans-unit.target: You can combine layers of materials to build more complex materials. For example, this screenshot shows the blending of a rust material (left) with a gold material (right):

trans-unit.source: This diagram shows the definition of the materials blended in the screenshot above:
trans-unit.target: This diagram shows the definition of the materials blended in the screenshot above:

trans-unit.source: Blend maps are material maps that determine how Game Studio blends layers. For example, you can use a texture as a blend map:
trans-unit.target: Blend maps are material maps that determine how Game Studio blends layers. For example, you can use a texture as a blend map:

trans-unit.source: Note how the blend map texture corresponds to the patterning on the result.
trans-unit.target: Note how the blend map texture corresponds to the patterning on the result.

trans-unit.source: Blend maps work the same way as any other kind of material map. For more information, see Material maps.
trans-unit.target: Blend maps work the same way as any other kind of material map. For more information, see Material maps.

trans-unit.source: Stride blends materials differently depending on whether their shading models (eg diffuse models, specular models, etc) are different.
trans-unit.target: Stride blends materials differently depending on whether their shading models (eg diffuse models, specular models, etc) are different.

trans-unit.source: If you blend materials that have identical shading models, Stride collects the attributes of the materials, then applies the shading models to all of them. This saves GPU.
trans-unit.target: If you blend materials that have identical shading models, Stride collects the attributes of the materials, then applies the shading models to all of them. This saves GPU.

trans-unit.source: If the materials have different shading models, Stride applies each material's shading models to that material's attributes, then blends the results. This uses more GPU.
trans-unit.target: If the materials have different shading models, Stride applies each material's shading models to that material's attributes, then blends the results. This uses more GPU.

trans-unit.source: Select the material you want to add a layer to.
trans-unit.target: Select the material you want to add a layer to.

trans-unit.source: In the Property Grid (on the right by default), next to Layers, click Green plus button (Add).
trans-unit.target: In the Property Grid (on the right by default), next to Layers, click Green plus button (Add).

trans-unit.source: Game Studio adds a layer to the material.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio adds a layer to the material.

trans-unit.source: Next to the layer, click Hand icon (Select an asset).
trans-unit.target: Next to the layer, click Hand icon (Select an asset).

trans-unit.source: The Select an asset window opens.
trans-unit.target: The Select an asset window opens.

trans-unit.source: Specify a material you want to add as a layer and click OK.
trans-unit.target: Specify a material you want to add as a layer and click OK.

trans-unit.source: Game Studio adds the material as a layer.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio adds the material as a layer.

trans-unit.source: Next to Blend Map, click Blue arrow button (Replace) and select the type of blend map you want to use to blend the layers. For more information about blend maps, see Material maps.
trans-unit.target: Next to Blend Map, click Blue arrow button (Replace) and select the type of blend map you want to use to blend the layers. For more information about blend maps, see Material maps.

trans-unit.source: Game Studio blends the material layers using the blend map you specified. You can add as many layers as you need.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio blends the material layers using the blend map you specified. You can add as many layers as you need.

trans-unit.source: The material blended in this layer
trans-unit.target: The material blended in this layer

trans-unit.source: The blend map used to blend this layer with the layer above
trans-unit.target: The blend map used to blend this layer with the layer above

trans-unit.source: UV Scale: A UV scale applied to all textures UV of the material of the layer (excluding the occlusion map)
trans-unit.target: UV Scale: A UV scale applied to all textures UV of the material of the layer (excluding the occlusion map)
